revised_title: The Isthmus of England and France: Historical Evidence and Geological Hypotheses
tldr: Dr. John Wallis examines historical evidence and geological hypotheses regarding the existence of an isthmus that once connected England and France. He discusses the arguments of other antiquaries, such as William Camden, and presents new evidence from the discovery of strange teeth and bones in the form of a well in Chartham. Wallis suggests that the isthmus was worn away by the sea over time, leading to the current narrow passage between Dover and Calais.
